title: The Woman Who Willed a Miracle
text:
"The Woman Who Willed a Miracle" is a 1983 episode of the American television anthology series "<a href="ABC%20Afterschool%20Special">ABC Afterschool Special</a>", starring <a href="Cloris%20Leachman">Cloris Leachman</a>, <a href="M.%20Emmet%20Walsh">M. Emmet Walsh</a>, <a href="Leif%20Green">Leif Green</a> and <a href="Rosemary%20Murphy">Rosemary Murphy</a>.
<a href="Dick%20Clark">Dick Clark</a> was the <a href="executive%20producer">executive producer</a> under the auspices of his company, <a href="Dick%20Clark%20Productions">Dick Clark Productions</a>. It was produced by <a href="Preston%20Fischer">Preston Fischer</a>, <a href="Sharron%20Miller">Sharron Miller</a>, and <a href="Joanne%20Curley-Kerner">Joanne Curley-Kerner</a>, and was <a href="Television%20director">directed</a> by <a href="Sharron%20Miller">Sharron Miller</a> and written by <a href="Arthur%20Heinemann">Arthur Heinemann</a>. It tells the extraordinary true story of <a href="Leslie%20Lemke">Leslie Lemke</a>, a <a href="Blindness">blind</a>, <a href="Mental%20retardation">cognitively impaired</a> boy with <a href="cerebral%20palsy">cerebral palsy</a> who was raised from infancy by a foster mother who stubbornly refused to let him die. Because of her love and dedication, he not only survived but was discovered to be a musical <a href="savant%20syndrome">savant</a>.
The "<a href="New%20York%20Times">New York Times</a>" called it one of the most famous of all Afterschool specials.
